the conflict will intensify further into

Sweden
Denmark's rising neighbor Sweden had
become increasingly concerned by the
Empire situation during the 1620s indeed
Sweden had already undertaken a small
intervention in the defence of Strauss
and in the summer of 1628 Denmark's
defeat at Valentines hands and sprains
continuing Dutch war had raised the
specter of a joint Catholic campaign of
economic warfare in the Baltics
the Swedes feared that Ferdinand would
ally with the polish-lithuanian
Commonwealth whose ruler Sigismund the
third had a claim to the Swedish throne
the king of Sweden established the
second and office has been in constant
conflict with the polish-lithuanian
Commonwealth ever since he took the
throne in 1611 and was largely
successful especially in the war of 1626
to 1629 the truce of alt mark between
the two sides were signed in 1629 it
being negotiated by French diplomats
stipulated that the Swedes would receive
the right to two thirds of all shipping
tolls at polish-lithuanian ports until
1635 which helped finance Sweden's war
effort substantially
though the Army's fighting for holy
roman emperor ferdinand ii had won
victories at looter and focused the
pressures and costs of maintaining such
a large army were beginning to mount the
emperor had chosen to rule by decree
which didn't help his popularity with
the princes of the empire so in summer
of 1630 the diet of Regensburg was
convened in an attempt to placate the
regional princes notably the rulers of
brandenburg and saxony did not attend in
protest of the Edict of restitution this
diet only made the situation worse as
the electors who hated Obrecht font
Valentine forced Ferdinand to dismiss
him and he retired to his Bohemian
estates the Imperial Army was also
massively downsized in order to reduce
costs with the count of teal being
reinstated as supreme commander of the
Imperial Army as well as the Catholic
League army it created a massive power
vacuum
along with alienating the Protestant
Prince's further the Emperor sacrificed
Valentine and became weaker domestically
to retain the Edict of restitution but
this encouraged external powers to join
the conflict
in early June of 1630 Gustavus Adolphus
published a manifesto detailing the
advance of Imperial forces to the Baltic
the treatment of Swedish delegates and
imperial aggression against the Swedish
Straus and Garrison as reasons for the
intervention On June 26th he started his
campaign against Ferdinand by landing on
the island of OSA dome off the
Pomeranian coast
with a modest force of fourteen thousand
soldiers
after disembarking his army Adolphus
marched to Stetten and tolls the Duke of
pomerania boguslav xiv who was childless
that Pomerania was his by right of
conquest on August 25th the percent duke
accepted the Treaty of Stetten which
allowed Sweden to effectively annex the
region however the new territory was too
small and poor to sustain a large army
and the invaders struggled to break out
of the Imperial cordon throughout the
rest of 1630 repeated unsuccessful
attempts to punch through the imperial
troops commanded by Torquato Conti were
made at mecklenburg in the West and
along the Oder in the east this
lackluster start from the Swedes would
inspire a false confidence in ferdinand
ii that was soon to be tested another
problem was soon to arise for Ferdinand
France a fellow Catholic nation under
its first minister Cardinal Richelieu
the French were concerned about the
growing power of their old Habsburg
rivals and sought to deplete their
strength by any means necessary the
Treaty of bavander in January of 1631
obliged Sweden to maintain an army of at
least 36 thousand troops in the German
conflict while France paid $400,000 per
year in subsidies to Sweden to assist in
its upkeep
still the leading Lutheran German
princes the electors of Saxony and
Brandenburg would not form an alliance
with the Swedes who were initially
viewed as an unwelcome foreign presence
instead on April 12 16 31 they issued
the Leipzig manifesto and this agreement
became a Protestant defensive alliance
against any who might endanger them
Sweden or the Emperor 40,000 troops
would be raised for the cause an action
sanctioned by many of the moderate
Catholics who understood the desire for
safety

in Pomerania the swelling army of

men the Protestant Prince's who had met

defended by Imperial Garrison's though
he had begun to make slowed progress it

the only significant Swedish Ally thus
far the city of Magdeburg which had

reinforcements brought to the city siege

what followed was the single most
horrific massacre of the entire 30 years
war the flames claimed many lives but

mercenary soldiers
despite Till's orders to stop the

enacted brutal violence on the
unfortunate inhabitants of Magdeburg a

that out of the roughly 25,000

outrage in Protestants
to the east gustavus adolphus maste
26,000 strong force outside the

new forces the swedish king was now

convinced a victory would make other
German Protestants join him meanwhile
teal was also eager to pursue the

about to take place
teyla's army which was advancing to meet
the swedes dispatched smaller parties
which engaged in skirmishes with them
and the swedes apparently got the better

Elbe at Wittenberg and moved south to
join with his German allies finally the
two sides converged on a broad plain
near the village of Brighton felled in
September of 1630 one
now we must take a moment to discuss the
army and state which engaged at Brighton
failed on that day in 1631 and its
illustrious leader since 1397 the three
ancient Nordic kingdoms had been ruled
by Denmark but Sweden broke away in 1523
and elected Gustav Vasa as their King
beginning the vasa dynasty after a
dynastic crisis Charles the ninth became
King dying in 1611 and being succeeded
by his son gustav ii adolf otherwise
known as Gustavus Adolphus when this
happened the coffers were almost empty
the population was on the verge of
rebellion and the army was lacks the
military failures of Sweden at this time
were exemplified in the Battle of Kirk
home during 1605 when its army was
annihilated by a Polish Lithuanian force
one-third its size conscription had
taken place in Sweden for decades but it
was poorly administered Gustavus
Adolphus established and enforced
guidelines for recruitment while the
realm was divided up into eight military
districts from which a permanently
established army would be raised
intensive training and drill routines
made this system greatly successful and
foreigners marveled at how mere farmers
lads could be turned into disciplined
soldiers
[Music]
increased firepower was a key priority
for gustavus adolphus
who realized that it was the key to
victory and was required to compensate
for the inferiority of Swedish cavalry
infantry squadrons maintained the
central pike block flanked by Musketeers
but with a higher proportion of muskets
compared to Pike's
formations were also shallower and
broader bringing more firepower to bear
on the enemy the counter march was also
drilled into the soldiers during which
the front rank would fire a volley and
then marched through the gaps to the
rear to reload followed by the second
rank and so on doubling the files was
also a new tactic developed by the king
during which the rear ranks would step
into the gaps used for the counter march
in order to deliver a devastating salvo
in addition to the infantry changes
batteries of four light three pounder
artillery pieces were attached to
Swedish regiments they were maneuverable
above all else in order to go where they
were needed on the battlefield compared
to the heavy cannons which had to stay
where they were
the Protestant army led by Swedish King
Gustavus Adolphus consisted of around
42,000 troops 24,000 Swedish veteran
soldiers were joined by 18,000 under the
elector of Saxony
but were camped separate the Swedes were
organized into seven infantry brigades
in two lions commanded by caste Abbess
Adolphus himself
they had 51 field artillery pieces
supported by a battery of four
state-of-the-art mobile bronze cast
three pounder light guns attached to
each infantry regiment opposite them
were the Imperials under your hand sir
classgraph von tiehl who had 35,000 men
under his command of whom 7000 had just
completed an exhausting march from the
south their infantry was organized into
12 large tokyo's grouped in threes and
with to further battalions on each flank
to support the cavalry the imperials has
27 field artillery pieces likely of a
heavier caliber than those of the Swedes
around midday the battle began with a
thunderous two hour long exchange of
artillery fire between the two sides in
addition to their numerical superiority
in number of guns
the Swedes demonstrated fantastic
efficiency firing three to five volleys
for each Imperial volley the deeper and
more densely packed Imperial Tokyo's
suffered especially badly from this
bombardment when the bombardment ceased
four thousand Imperial black Kyra Sears
on tears left wing charged without
orders commanded by gottfried soup
Oppenheim repeated attacks were made on
the position of Field Marshal Johan
banners Swedish cavalry but too little
effect
the small musketeer companies between
each squadron of fired at
point-blank range as the Imperial
cavalry charge disrupting them blunting
the attack and allowing their own
cavalry to counter charged with an
advantage after the seventh attempt to
break his wing had failed banner sallied
forth with his finished light cavalry
and swedish heavy cavalry smashing the
depleted imperial horse and forcing us
to flee the field during this action the
main infantry force and a teal hat
remained stationary however a subsequent
cavalry charge on the Imperial right
wing by another 4,000 Catholic League
and Croat horse under von furstenberg
crashed into the saxon cavalry guarding
this area of the battlefield seeing an
opportunity teal then ordered his tow
Theo's to advance in an oblique order
formation diagonally and to the right by
doing this he sought to concentrate his
assault on the untrained Saxon infantry
on the Protestants left flank refusing
to engage the Swedes for now this worked
out and the entire Saxon force routed in
front of them leaving the Swedish flank
exposed
Marshall Gustav horn who commanded this
threatened area of the Swedish line
quickly and orderly pulled back before
the unwieldy tercios could regroup and
change direction as they were busy
plundering the Saxon baggage or pursuing
fleeing soldiers he then launched a
counter-attack with his reorganized
cavalry forces during this
counter-attack the engaged infantry
regiments pivoted and concentrated their
new high firepower tactics and their
accompanying three-pound artillery
pieces on the tercios threatening their
left and repelled the Imperial attack at
the same time the victorious cavalry of
banner now commanded directly by their
King Gustavus Adolphus swept across the
frontline and attacks the now lightly
defended Imperial left this assault
managed to achieve its aim of capturing
the stationary Imperial cannon which
were then turned by the swedes and used
to attack their owners marshal leonard
Torsten son commanding the Swedish Field
Artillery also maneuvered his lighter
more flexible guns into position and
pummeled the Imperials as well hitting
them from both sides after a few hours
of this withering firepower the Imperial
forces finally collapsed and Papen Heim
as well as till himself were both
wounded 7600 Imperial soldiers were
killed and a further six thousand were
captured
the Catholic army had been utterly
annihilated by the Swedish and their
Saxon allies and had to be completely
rebuilt from scratch
while the victory convinced many
wavering Protestant Prince's to join the
victors swelling their army after so
many Catholic victories in the early
years of the war it seemed as though the
Protestant cause was on the rise thanks
